txt.en: 'Perhaps you are right, [placeholder].'
'Enough of that wretch! Come, we must find the horses and escape!'
'The war is over, Mágla! You said it yourself!'
'To die sulking in a hall is a sorry end for a warrior.'
'Here they come again!'
'My life is owed to my family, my people, and Rohan.'
'Ah, good fortune at last! I see steeds ahead.'
'It is not mine to toss aside...'
'Run, [placeholder]! We must flee before they can overwhelm us!'
Instance: Trading Fates
'They are here, [placeholder].'
'It is worse than I feared, [placeholder].'
'Let us meet them, and see if we cannot escape to Edoras!'
'They have set flame to Middlemead!'
'We must move with haste, and search for any horses that yet remain.'
'Here they come!'
'Swiftly now! We must reach the traders' pavillion!'
'None here! But...'
'How dare you show your face here again!'
'You would have starved us all, and left us defenceless!'
'Hildulf! Look what you have done!'
'And to taunt me with the death of my closest kinsman...'
'No fate is too cruel for you!'
'Nay! These are your just rewards!'
'But my riches...'
'Come, [placeholder], drink with me.'
'As I see it, the war has long been over.'
'To send my people away was not a gesture of salvation...'
'Instead, I sought to grant them hope in the fleeting days of Rohan...'
'...to grant them hope that there still remained a place to run.'
'I wager the White Hand will be here before long, and here shall they find me.'
'Fine drinks and an end to my suffering...'
'Is it not a good death?'
'Hail, Mágla!'
'Fear not, it saddens me to see my home burn as well...'
'Yet, I find knowing what treasures await me lessens the blow.'
'You speak true, but ever the wise warrior, I knew you had eyes everywhere.'
'No? What hope do you see then?'
'Regrettably, [placeholder] was a problem I could not solve. Unlike Egbalth...'
'Ah, strength and hope from such unlikely places, but I am no warrior. Not anymore...'
'We shall see, Mágla. I find the White Hand mightier than the lot of you...'
